about

this site

My long term goal is to have a website that exists as an artefact of my personal, professional and creative selves. A place outside myself where they can intermingle in a more systematic way. Ideally, the result is interesting content for you, the reader. But please note, this site is as much for me, as it is for you.

On this site, an internal link looks like this, while an external link like this.
Time is measured in Arvelie time. Year 0 is 2020. To simplify browsing by date range, the first two digits are years since 2020. 'M' is the middle of the year. Why do this?.

tjex

I've done many things, but now I code. I took a scenic route so to say.

Currently I'm writing my masters thesis on the mechanics behind the Zettelkasten system, how these mechanics facilitate creative ideation, and what software solutions I can build to best support that process. I'm also the core maintainer of the Zettelkasten note taking CLI tool, zk.

Before finding a home in programming, I was working in the arts / music industry as a producer of story music, film composer, and sound engineer. I was also the head engineer and studio manager of MONOM, a state-of-the-art spatial audio studio in Berlin, which saw my two loves of music and technology come together and insighted me to investigate further by means of the above mentioned masters degree.

I'm also a qualified remedial massage therapist, which has seen me work for sporting teams, in clinics, on yachts and in luxury saunas. I train Jiu Jitsu and am working at becoming a better swimmer.
